channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Harvard resolves lawsuit alleging professor's harassment, intimidation
item.description: Harvard University and three students resolved a federal lawsuit claiming the institution overlooked sexual harassment complaints against professor John Comaroff and allowed intimidation tactics. The 2022 lawsuit, dismissed without costs, accused Comaroff of unwanted advances and threats to students' careers. Settlement terms weren't disclosed, but the students' courage in speaking out was lauded.

item.title: MAGA calls Harris 'Comrade Kamala' after she promises price-control 'like Venezuela, Cuba'
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris Friday unveiled her economic plan promising tax cuts for the middle class, expand child tax credit, federal ban of price gouging. The Trump campaign in response called Kamala Harris Comrade Kamala and said price controls exist in Soviet, Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Itâ€™s truly a matter of life and death ... ': This police association endorses Donald Trump and J D Vance
item.description: Republican VP nominee JD Vance visited Wisconsin's Milwaukee Police Association, securing their endorsement along with President Donald Trump. Vance addressed issues like low bail for dangerous criminals, low officer morale, and staffing shortages. The MPA emphasized that solutions to these challenges are crucial for Milwaukee's safety and wellbeing, backing Trump's ticket for these reasons.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Ethnic enclaves': JD Vance sparks backlash over comments linking immigrants to crime
item.description: JD Vance, the Republican vice-presidential candidate, made controversial remarks about 'ethnic enclaves' and crime during a campaign event. Vance implied that these communities elevate crime rates due to inadequate assimilation. Critics condemned his comments as racist, pointing to research that contradicts his claims. Vance cited his wife's successful assimilation as a positive example.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US Secretary of State Blinken to embark on Israel visit today, push for Gaza ceasefire
item.description: The United States Secretary of State, Antony Blinken is set to embark on visit to Israel on Saturday, August 17, to push for efforts to conclude the agreement for a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, as well as the release of hostages from Gaza.

item.title: Trump Force Two carrying JD Vance makes emergency landing: 'Malfunction with door seal'
item.description: Trump Force Two, a Boeing 737 which was carrying Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance, made an emergency landing in Milwaukee after the pilot discovered a door seal malfunction. Last week, Trump Force One had an emergency landing with Trump onboard. Apart from Vance, Trump Force Two had Vance's wife Usha, their dog Atlas and the other staff, Secret Service agents and some journalists.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Election officials keep Green Party presidential candidate on Wisconsin ballot
item.description: Wisconsin elections officials dismissed a complaint by a Democratic National Committee employee to remove Jill Stein from the presidential ballot. The Wisconsin Elections Commission had previously granted ballot access to Stein. This clears the way for a potential lawsuit. Stein's presence could impact the tight presidential race in the battleground state.

item.title: Kamala Harris unveils economic plan; Woos voters with price-cutting plans
item.description: Kamala Harris introduced an economic plan aimed at reducing expenses for families and holding corporations accountable for price gouging. Her agenda included tax cuts, expanded healthcare, and support for first-time home buyers. A federal ban on price gouging and empowering regulatory bodies to penalize offenders were notable measures, along with boosting housing and reducing prescription drug costs.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Senator Bob Menendez replaced: New Jersey governor Phil Murphy appoints this former chief of staff as temporary US Senator
item.description: Governor Phil Murphy appointed former chief of staff George Helmy as interim US Senator for New Jersey following Bob Menendez's corruption conviction. Helmy will serve until the November election results are certified, ensuring a smooth transition. The race features Democratic Representative Andy Kim and Republican Curtis Bashaw, aiming to maintain stability and continuity in the Senate seat.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump wants Tulsi Gabbard's help to prepare for debate against Kamala Harris as...
item.description: Tulsi Gabbard who left the Democratic Party after her 2020 presidential run will help former president Donald Trump to prepare for the debate against Kamala Harris, the New York Times reported citing sources. Practice sessions are being held at Trump's private club and home, Mar-a-Lago. And the reason Trump believes Tulsi is the best person for this purpose is because of her memorable performance against Kamala in a 2019 Democratic presidential primary debate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump's campaign rehires Corey Lewandowski as 'senior adviser' after 8 years
item.description: Corey Lewandowski was rehired as a senior adviser to Donald Trump's upcoming campaign, eight years after being dismissed. The move comes as the campaign faces funding and polling challenges. Lewandowski joins other former aides to strengthen leadership. Despite past controversies, Trump expressed confidence in the team's ability to compete against Kamala Harris.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Amid outrage over internet slowdown, Pakistan government admits installing cybersecurity firewall
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: American Airlines domestic flight lands in Bahamas: 'Y'all are illegal immigrants here'
item.description: Passengers of an American Airlines flight were called immigrants as they were stranded in the Bahamas for 24 hours owing to "excruciating circumstances". The flight from San Juan, Puerto Rico to Miami, Florida -- carrying around 90 passengers -- was detoured to the Bahamas because of Hurricane Debby and there was no accommodation for the passengers. Dimas Henriquez, as passenger of flight 2421, told Fox News Digital that they were called illegal immigrants at the island nation though they were nothing to do with the emergency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris asks Tim Walz what's 'White guy tacos'. Internet doesn't approve
item.description: Vice president Kamala Harris and her running mater Tim Walz sat down for an interview with each other where they spoke about tacos, music and the future of America -- leaving the MAGA supporters enraged that they had time to interview each other but no time to face the press. The video was released yesterday on all the official channels and a day later, it has now irked the social media which thinks 'White guys' have been mocked in the video.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Pathetic', 'disgusting': Fans react as 'Hawk Tuah Girl' throws first pitch at New York Mets game
item.description: Haliey Welch, also known as the "Hawk Tuah Girl," threw the ceremonial first pitch at the New York Mets game, which received mixed reactions. Known for a viral comment, Welch attended to support America's VetDogs, a charity for war veterans. Despite her appearance, the Mets lost to the Oakland Athletics 7-6 in a long game.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Big tantrum going on in Trump campaign, nobody understands Hannibal Lecter'
item.description: Ex-White House communications director Anthony Scaramucci Friday said there is a big tantrum going on in the Trump campaign that no one understands or relates to what he says. Scaramucci attributed to this to "many people...The best minds". After Thursday's press conference by Trump, Scaramucci said Trump is psychologically coming to grips with losing the election and hence he's growing darker. "Will be a rough 81 days," he posted.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Investor vs Actor: Kevin Spacey in Standoff over Baltimore mansion foreclosure dispute
item.description: Kevin Spacey was embroiled in a legal dispute after allegedly refusing to vacate his Baltimore mansion following its foreclosure. Investor Sam Asgari acquired the home in a foreclosure auction for $3.24 million but faced difficulties in taking possession. Spaceyâ€™s attorney denied the claims, while Spacey dealt with ongoing financial and legal challenges.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Socialist' Kamala to roll out policies Trump sees as 'leftist'
item.description: Vice-President Kamala Harris announced new populist proposals including a federal ban on price gouging for groceries, a $25,000 subsidy for first-time home buyers, and child tax credits. These measures are aimed at addressing the rising cost of living and countering criticism of her policy direction, especially ahead of the Democratic National Convention.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Who is Heman Bekele, 'TIME's 2024 Kid of the Year' treating skin cancer?
item.description: Heman Bekele, a 15-year-old from Fairfax County, Virginia, was named TIME's Kid of the Year for 2024 for his innovative skin-cancer-fighting soap. Inspired by childhood memories in Ethiopia, Bekele utilized lipid-based nanoparticles to deliver imiquimod. His invention earned him recognition and a $25,000 prize from the 3M Young Scientist Challenge.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Americans at risk after hackers steal Social Security data of nearly 3 billion individuals: Is your SS number safe?
item.description: A data breach at National Public Data compromised information of nearly three billion individuals. Hacker group USDoD stole and sold records with names, addresses, birth dates, phone numbers, and Social Security numbers. Experts advise freezing credit files and strengthening account security. Identity theft protection services offer alerts, and affected individuals should visit IdentityTheft.gov for recovery plans.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
